website_summaries.verdict: From a European company with a long history in the business, these shears are extremely sturdy and reliable.
pros: Rust-resistant blades are made of carbon steel
arms are made of tubular steel
Grips are soft and easy on the hands
Many owners say it makes yard work easier on the back
cons: Some buyers were not completely satisfied with blade quality

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed for weeds and long grass.
customer_reviews.text: I deliberated over these for a couple months because they were so expensive, but they're well worth the money. Unlike the cheaper swiveling grass shears I tried previously, the blades on these do not flop around - they're fixed, and they're much longer and sturdier. This makes all the difference in ease of use. I caught up with a couple months' worth of weeds in about a week, and now my neighbors aren't glaring at me anymore. I'm old and not that strong and they were easy to use, and so far maintenance has just been wiping off the blades when grass sticks to them.
customer_reviews.author: randomlychosen

customer_reviews.title: Easy on an 82 year old back
customer_reviews.text: Easy on an 82 year old back. However, it does not cut iris and lily leaves if you try to grab too many at a time. My advice is "slow and easy", cut not more than 3 or 4 leaves at a time and enjoy not having to bend over, Now waiting for the invention of something to pick up the debris and put it in the wheel barrel!
customer_reviews.author: Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but...
customer_reviews.text: It got stuck after only a few minutes of use on day one. I struggled that day with "unstucking" it every couple of minutes before giving up. Being handy I made an adjustment to the tension of the pivot bolt and tested it again. It did not get stuck but is not going as smoothly as I would like it to. It is a bit heavy for an old person or a person with weaker arms. I will keep it for now as I do have use for it. Hopefully it will perform. A customer should not be making adjustments to a new tool. Thus my two-star rating
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Works well from my mobility scooter for close trimming.
customer_reviews.text: Trimming around plants from a mobility scooter is hard on the back do to the bending, this allows me trim around plants while seated. Unable to open the blades fully because the scooter gets in the way but being able to slide the blades along the ground makes that less of a problem as you don't have to lift them as much as you would expect. Does not replace a power trimmer for the bulk of the weeds but allows you to trim close without chopping off flowers and veggies by accident.
customer_reviews.author: P. Fram

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for trimming grass around my fence. It does stick a bit but a little WD40 and it’s good again. Box it was shipped in was too small- and the blade point was sticking out of the box. Not sure how else it could be shipped but it doesn’t seem to be damaged.

customer_reviews.title: Does not last

I have had it for about 4 months and used it perhaps once a week, but one of the handles has already broken off. Very disappointed.

product_meta.title: Spear & Jackson 4901RSS Razorsharp Steel Lawn Shears
product_meta.description: The Razorsharp steel lawn shears are designed to meet the most demanding standards, with tubular steel handles for extra strength and durability. The hollow ground c50 carbon steel blades provide lasting sharpness and are polished and lacquered for rust resistance. Spear & Jackson's foundations were laid in 1760, since our beginnings centuries of experience and innovation have resulted in the materials and development expertise that resides within the company today; and "continuous innovation" is at the heart of the company's ethos. This drive to improve product materials and performance can be seen in many different ways across the company's 3,000 lines. The organisation has come a long way since 1760, and the spear & Jackson group now manufactures and distributes garden tools, metrology equipment, woodworking tools, metal working tools, saw blades and magnetic equipment. With divisions across England, France and Australia, spear & Jackson is a world-wide brand, distributing products throughout the world. Our tools are manufactured to a high quality standard and offer superb service and longevity; guaranteed against defects in manufacturing, subject to normal wear & tear and the provision of reasonable care and maintenance. This does not affect your statutory rights.
